objects.name: Créditos
objects.string: Desenvolvido por Marcus Neto & Sebastian Galvis

content.text: Desenvolvido por Marcus Neto & Sebastian Galvis

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: EllipseMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects on ellipses or smoothly back and forth in one direction.
description: It allows objects to move:
- on an ellipsis or arcs
- smoothly vertically or horizontally (by setting one radius to 0)
- on a sine wave (by adding a force)
It can be used for:
- Making objects float, such as powerups or coins
- Moving platforms
- Enemy movement patterns
- Making a player constantly turn right or left ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://star-seeker))

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move objects on ellipses or smoothly back and forth in one direction.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: EllipseMovement

events.comment: Evaluate the center of movement from the object position and properties.
Update the center when the object is moved outside of the behavior.
Place the object according to the movement angle.
Save the position to detect when the object is moved outside of the behavior.
Update the movement angle for the next frame.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: LinearMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects on a straight line.
description: Move objects on a straight line or according to their angle.

It can be used for simple enemies or bullets. It's usually not adapted for players (other behaviors are a better choice) or bullets fired with the actions provided by the "Fire Bullet" behavior (these bullets are already moved using a force).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move objects on a straight line.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: LinearMovement

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move objects ahead according to their angle.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: LinearMovementByAngle

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Turret
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A turret movement with customizable speed, acceleration and stop angles.
description: With this behavior, you can make an object rotate like a turret toward a position.
It may be used with the **Bullet** extension to fire objects.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: A turret movement with customizable speed, acceleration and stop angles.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Turret

parameters: mod(ToDeg(atan2(TargetY - Object.Y(), TargetX - Object.X())) - OriginAngle, 360) + OriginAngle

No stop angle, the direction is chosen according to the shortest path (never more that 180°)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DraggablePhysics
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Drag a physics object with the mouse (or touch).
description: Enables players to click and drag on physics objects to move them.  The object retains velocity when the click is released, allowing players to fling objects across the screen.
Note:
- The default "draggable" behavior will not work on objects with the physics behavior. This extension should be used instead.
- This extension will only work on objects that have the physics behavior.
- Kinematic physics mode is incompatible with this extension. The object will be changed to dynamic mode.
The Parking Jam example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://parking-jam)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Drag a physics object with the mouse (or touch).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ButtonStates
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Use any object as a button and change appearance according to user interactions.
description: Use the "Button states" behavior to track user interactions with an object, including:
- Hovered
- Pressed
- Clicked
- Idle
Add additional behaviors to make juicy buttons with animated responses to user input:
- Size
- Color
- Animation
- Object effects

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Bouh, @arthuro555
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CursorType
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Provides an action to change the type of the cursor, and a behavior to change the cursor when an object is hovered.
description: Provides an action to change the type of the cursor, and a behavior to change the cursor when an object is hovered.
Find the list of cursors here: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor

eventsFunctions.description: Change the type of the cursor.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeCursorType

events.comment:
Set as variable instead of directly setting as a CursorHover behavior can override it.
By using a variable, we ensure to be able to change it back to that "default" after the override is over.

eventsFunctions.description: Do change the type of the cursor.
eventsFunctions.name: DoChangeCursorType

events.comment: Reset ordering as the object with highest Z-Order might not exist anymore or be not be hovered anymore.

events.comment: Check the z Order to ensure the cursor shown is the one from the foremost object

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CurvedMovement
description: This extension allows to move objects on Bézier curve paths.
- Paths can be built dynamically or from predetermined paths in SVG format.
- A behavior moves objects in a given duration a bit like the Tween extension does.
- Another behavior moves objects using a speed and an acceleration.
- Expressions give access to the path trajectory values for more complex movements.
This extension can be used to:
- Move enemies that follow a pattern
- Animate decorations
A collection of [small examples](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://curved-movement) shows how to use this extension.
2 examples use it:
- a 3D racing game ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://3d-racing-game))
- a Zuma-like ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://smoothy))

events.comment: Update speed
Update the position on the path (the current length) with a Verlet integration.
It's useful to know which way to look at when the speed reached 0.

parameters: AngleBetweenPositions(Object.X(), Object.Y(), DestinationX, Object.Y() + (DestinationY - Object.Y()) / Object.Behavior::PathSpeedScaleY()) - AngleBetweenPositions(0, 0, Object.Behavior::PathEndX(),  Object.Behavior::PathEndY() / Object.Behavior::PathSpeedScaleY())
